chapters.name: Chapter XVI.-He Very Easily Understood the Liberal Arts and the Categories of Aristotle, But Without True Fruit.

paragraphs.text: Then follows a period of nine years from the nineteenth year of his age, during which having lost a friend, he followed the Manichaeans-and wrote books on the fair and fit, and published a work on the liberal arts, and the categories of Aristotle.

chapters.name: Chapter I.-Concerning that Most Unhappy Time in Which He, Being Deceived, Deceived Others; And Concerning the Mockers of His Confession.
